metadata.name: Pixzle #26
metadata.description:
Pixzle is created by @platformmmm - a collection of generative pieces inspired by my love of geometric art and the Gameboy 8-bit aesthetic.

Made from overlapping png images using @PureSpider’s template

metadata.name: Tessellatum #35
metadata.description:
Tessellatum – a collection inspired by mosaic and weaving craftworks.

The artworks were created by applying a p5.js generative algorithm simulating mosaic, pointillism and weaving-like textures on a library of images issued/exported from a generative flowfield algorithm in R (The R Project for Statistical Computing). In other words, to avoid any ambiguity, the R issued images on which the mosaics effects are applied are not generated on the fxhash platform, but the mosaic effects (noise, size and shape of the tiles), the backgrounds and various other generative elements are via a p5.js implementation.

metadata.name: The Restoration Scheme: Shape Observation #46
metadata.description:
“Shape Observation” is the first episode of “The Restoration Scheme” Series. The work was based on Staghorn Coral. 

Living on the land, we have few opportunities to see corals in real life.
Most of my impressions of corals come from photos and illustrations.
So I think the first person who discovers coral must be stunned by its shape and color.
They may paint hundreds of pictures like this.

——

“The Restoration Scheme” Series

It’s a virtual action extended from the coral restoration plan led by Delta Electronics Foundation from Taiwan, consisting of five generative corals. Each of them was based on five different species of coral as the theme.

If collectors mint virtual corals, Delta Electronics Foundation will drop coral seedlings collectively in the sea. 

The project is powered by FAB DAO (Formosa Art Bank). The split will donate to the local organization from Taiwan dedicated to the coral restoration scheme.

——

About Delta 

Climate change is causing irreversible impacts. Coral reefs, known for their rich biodiversity and the capability to nourish a quarter of marine life, are at the forefront of the crisis. 

Also known as "tropical rainforests" in the sea, coral reefs have experienced five mass bleaching events in the past five years. Once global warming exceeds the 2˚C thresholds, it's likely that 99% of coral reefs will die off worldwide.

In addition to launching a coral restoration initiative along the northeast coast of Taiwan, Delta Electronics Foundation collaborates with Asia University to host "Earth Pulsing: Nurturing Life Exhibition" and releases the first art NFT featuring coral restoration. Through these actions, we hope to evoke public awareness of ecological issues. 

For more information, please visit https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

——

Features
Iterations: 1 ~ 4
Tail: round, sharp
Feathering: yes, no
Color yes, no
Paper: normal, colored, white
Weight: regular, thin, bold
Special: -
Growth Speed: regular, slow, super slow

double click or press 's' to save as an image

made with p5.js

____________________________

《形狀觀察》為《恢復方案》系列第一作，品種為鹿角軸孔珊瑚。

在陸地上生活的我們其實能實際見到珊瑚的機會不多，我想起珊瑚的印象，最多是來自照片與畫。
於是想起了第一個發現珊瑚的人，一定會為他的形狀與顏色感到驚嘆不已。
所以我想像，他也許曾經畫下上百張類似這樣的畫面。

——

《恢復方案》
恢復方案是虛擬演算珊瑚實驗，一系列共五件的生成珊瑚作品，每一件對應到特定珊瑚物種。本實驗與台達電子文教基金會合作，藏家每收藏一件 NFT，台達電子文教基金會就會實際在海中植下一株對應的珊瑚苗。

這項專案與 FAB DAO （福爾摩沙藝術銀行）支援鑄造，部分分潤將直接捐助給台灣在地珊瑚保育組織，詳細資訊將於 FAB DAO Twitter 公佈。

——

關於台達電子文教基金會

氣候變遷引發許多不可逆的環境衝擊，以豐富生物多樣性著稱、滋養四分之一海洋生物的珊瑚，便是首當其衝的受害者。

被譽為「海中熱帶雨林」的珊瑚生態系，已在最近五年遭遇三次大白化，一旦升溫跨越攝氏2℃，屆時恐有多達99％的珊瑚瀕臨滅絕。

近年在東北角投入珊瑚復育的台達電子文教基金會，今年與亞洲大學共同策畫「地球˙脈動中」生態與藝術特展，並合作發行全台首見的珊瑚生成藝術NFT，喚起社會大眾對生態議題的重視。

更多資訊可參考: https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

metadata.name: Apparenza #112
metadata.description:
Apparenza is just the surface of an inner world, of an inner emotional status.
Apparenza sometimes does not represent reality, sometimes it resembles it.

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

@AlfredoBoaron

metadata.name: Smooth-brained #262
metadata.description:
A Generative Art Project by Matthew Hawtin & Murat Atimtay. Smooth-brained is part of the fxhash live minting experience at Proof of People, London 2022.

The initial visual idea for ‘Smooth-brained’ was to use one pixel and a two-colour gradient in multiple ways across a grid, using repetition, orientation, placement and scale, resulting in a visual composition that became the genesis piece. From that original artwork, Murat took the premise and through creative-coding, began to expand and experiment on the parameters, introducing new visual possibilities and paving the way for this collaborative generative art collection. The beauty of a gradient is that it gives the impression of depth and form on a 2D surface. This allows the visual fields to seem outward and also inward while giving the impression of movement within the whole piece and within individual cells; conjuring up spaces within spaces. The compositions are meant to be spaces for the eye to roam, decorative yet functional, complex yet minimal, a place where the brain is pleased and not duly complicated - a state of ‘smooth-brained’.

Press 1 to 8 export PNG between 1000px to 8000px

metadata.name: el inefable momento #1012
metadata.description:
"el inefable momento del colorido descubrimiento" ("the ineffable moment of the colorful discovery")  is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

It is a tribute to playful discovery. This work was commissioned for the Art Basel Hong Kong / Tezos / fxhash collaboration, as part of an activity to introduce visitors into generative art. As I was pondering what could I do in the short time available, I saw my youngest daughter drawing: the ineffable moment of colorful discovery. Child play is one of the most discovery-filled activities I can think of. And drawing is that joy that I describe: a blank piece of paper with a crayon is pure possibility. Which is what generative art is. I had wanted for quite some time to create a tribute to those drawings my daughters do, and this has been the perfect occasion to start it: it seemed to me that it fit the occasion perfectly: kids discover through painting, maybe adults can discover generative art using the same visual language.

"el inefable momento del colorido descubrimiento" is a work that explores colour and irregular basic shapes, and that leaves the viewer in front of a new space with each execution. Does it trigger any excitement to see those imperfect elements? It is dearest to me to see the hearts and rainbows, as two mainstays of the drawings that I keep in folders and count in the hundreds and thousands. Can an algorithm that reproduces those elements trigger the same warm feelings in the viewer? It does with me.

The piece lets the viewer explore certain characteristics. The viewer can pause the iterations: each is just an execution of the same drawing, slightly different. When paused, one can look at each line individually and notice how the drawing is constructed. When running, it gives an idea of how the things we know are just versions of the ideal concept they represent. 

Also, one can have an idea of what would have happened if the child had decided to draw more or less elements. The viewer can press “e” to see different variations of the same piece: random elements are selected and displayed. To restore the original work, press “r”. Which one is the “finished” artwork? All of them. What is “the” artwork? 

The work has the following commands:

- Change the work: “e”. To restore: “r”
- The painting can be paused/unpaused pressing “p”
- The viewer can save an artwork pressing “s” (it will pause the piece, press "p" to unpause)
- The resolution can be arbitrarily changed pressing “d” followed by a number from 1 to 9. If the image goes dark and nothing paints, press “d 0” (d zero) and try again with a lower number. Resolution can be increased iteratively: press d 2, then d 2, etc. It will always add the amount to the current pixel density, thus increasing resolution.
- The viewer can see how many decisions are made per iteration. This might be interesting to those who don’t know how generative art works. Each iteration is composed of thousands of decisions that inform colour, positions, shapes, etc. To toggle the decision count view, press “q”
- It has also colour controls: press z for brightness, x for contrast, g for gamma, b for blur, n for noise followed by + or - to alter their values. You might get some simple variations that you might enjoy. Press a to enable/disable all colour controls (except the noise).
- There are some pre-recorded colour variations: press “v” followed by 1, 2 or 3. Press “v” followed by 0 (zero) to reset the variations.

In every process of discovery, one comes to an "aha" moment ;) If you find your aha moment, then you can do one more thing: you can play with the size of certain elements pressing “o”. To restore, reload the piece. Once you find your aha moment, you can go back the same way you got there. All the controls work the same when one has reached their aha moment.

I hope you enjoy the piece as much as I have enjoyed drawing it, directly or indirectly, with my daughters. Thanks.

Artwork by Marcelo Soria-Rodríguez, @msoriaro.
Made with p5js and glsl.

Artwork by Marcelo Soria-Rodríguez, @msoriaro.
Made with p5js and glsl.

metadata.name: The Restoration Scheme: Shape Observation #30
metadata.description:

Living on the land, we have few opportunities to see corals in real life.

——

It’s a virtual action extended from the coral restoration plan led by Delta Electronics Foundation from Taiwan, consisting of five generative corals. Each of them was based on five different species of coral as the theme.

The project is powered by FAB DAO (Formosa Art Bank). The split will donate to the local organization from Taiwan dedicated to the coral restoration scheme.

——

Climate change is causing irreversible impacts. Coral reefs, known for their rich biodiversity and the capability to nourish a quarter of marine life, are at the forefront of the crisis. 

Also known as "tropical rainforests" in the sea, coral reefs have experienced five mass bleaching events in the past five years. Once global warming exceeds the 2˚C thresholds, it's likely that 99% of coral reefs will die off worldwide.

In addition to launching a coral restoration initiative along the northeast coast of Taiwan, Delta Electronics Foundation collaborates with Asia University to host "Earth Pulsing: Nurturing Life Exhibition" and releases the first art NFT featuring coral restoration. Through these actions, we hope to evoke public awareness of ecological issues. 

For more information, please visit https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

——

Features
Iterations: 1 ~ 4
Tail: round, sharp
Feathering: yes, no
Color yes, no
Paper: normal, colored, white
Weight: regular, thin, bold
Special: -
Growth Speed: regular, slow, super slow

double click or press 's' to save as an image

made with p5.js

____________________________

metadata.name: Sketch F #90
metadata.description:
Sketch is an open-ended series. Works evolve as I code a generative project, sometimes drastically. Intermediate works usually don't see the light of day - they get archived and forgotten. This series is snapshots of different forms along the way - each standing alone, but also part of a larger meandering work flow. The word Sketch implies incompleteness. This project may end up being two works, or it could evolve for years. Part of the joy of generative art is never knowing what's around the corner. I have no set schedule. There may be multiple Sketches released a week, or it could be weeks or months between drops. I have no idea where Sketch is heading and there is no guarantee of cohesiveness from Sketch to Sketch. Color palettes and forms will change as new ideas are explored.

Sketch F(ree). A gift to all Sketch A-E collectors. The underlying grid structure from A-E remains, but more variation on size and distribution is added. Many more color palettes are introduced. Grid size, padding, and colors vary.

metadata.name: Fracture #70
metadata.description:
Fragments of fragments, pieced together.


Please be patient as previews may take a while to generate.
Press 's' in live view to save the current image.
You can modify the URL to specify an image size. Keep in mind that the color palette, styles, and general look of the piece will generally remain the same, but a new image will be created to fit the new dimensions. To do this, add x and y URL parameters to the end of the URL. (Images are created using a pixel ratio of 2, so adding ?x=2560&y1440 to the end of the URL will actually create a 5120x2880 image.)


@teaboswell, 2022
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

For third party license information please see bundle.js.LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: Ridge Blur #192
metadata.description:
This work is the second in the ridge series. While using the same base algorithm this work is about exploring landscapes using a much more dark and desolate imagery.

It was designed to be experienced in fullscreen in live mode.
Press "s" to save a screenshot.

Dutch auction (14/11/8), updating every 5min.

Original artwork by William Watkins · Lyon, 2022

metadata.name: One Day #1
metadata.description:
One day I will have the peace, the happiness of being able to live quietly, with comfort in peace, nature, and technology side by side. The fresh air and the fast download, the sound of birds and my GPU, a nice sofa, and the calm, cool breeze on my face nourish me to the point of forgetting all my problems. One day... One day all this will be true and only peace will be my gift.

___________________________________________________

|| By pressing S in live mode you can save a image

___________________________________________________

|| Mushrooms have 15%
|| Flowers have 25%

If you are lucky, you can get both
___________________________________________________

Artwork made with p5.js, p5.grain, and much love.

metadata.name: Industry on Future Clouds #147
metadata.description:
"You can hear the machinery from afar"

Made with the Canvas API

Tijn Arts 2022

metadata.name: Ordinary Places #256
metadata.description:
“Ordinary Places” is a fully-coded meditation on the poetic beauty of everyday landscapes. 

The architectural characters in these landscapes include water towers (inspired by Bernd & Hilla Becher’s “Water Tower” photography series), gas stations (inspired by Ed Ruscha’s “26 Gasoline Stations” photography book), and barns (inspired by childhood memories on my grandfather’s farm). 

Yet, while these scenes may seem ordinary upon first glance, something darker lurks beneath the surface. The hidden secrets of these Ordinary Places can only be revealed through the minting process. In this sense, the outputs are not merely a collection individual scenes, but instead, a coherent world animated by shared themes and narratives.     

Pressing the down arrow saves the coded output as a .png image.

metadata.name: The Restoration Scheme: Shape Observation #63

Paper: normal, colored, white
Weight: regular, thin, bold
Special: -
Growth Speed: regular, slow, super slow

double click or press 's' to save as an image

made with p5.js

____________________________

《形狀觀察》為《恢復方案》系列第一作，品種為鹿角軸孔珊瑚。

在陸地上生活的我們其實能實際見到珊瑚的機會不多，我想起珊瑚的印象，最多是來自照片與畫。
於是想起了第一個發現珊瑚的人，一定會為他的形狀與顏色感到驚嘆不已。
所以我想像，他也許曾經畫下上百張類似這樣的畫面。

——

《恢復方案》
恢復方案是虛擬演算珊瑚實驗，一系列共五件的生成珊瑚作品，每一件對應到特定珊瑚物種。本實驗與台達電子文教基金會合作，藏家每收藏一件 NFT，台達電子文教基金會就會實際在海中植下一株對應的珊瑚苗。

這項專案與 FAB DAO （福爾摩沙藝術銀行）支援鑄造，部分分潤將直接捐助給台灣在地珊瑚保育組織，詳細資訊將於 FAB DAO Twitter 公佈。

——

關於台達電子文教基金會

氣候變遷引發許多不可逆的環境衝擊，以豐富生物多樣性著稱、滋養四分之一海洋生物的珊瑚，便是首當其衝的受害者。

被譽為「海中熱帶雨林」的珊瑚生態系，已在最近五年遭遇三次大白化，一旦升溫跨越攝氏2℃，屆時恐有多達99％的珊瑚瀕臨滅絕。

近年在東北角投入珊瑚復育的台達電子文教基金會，今年與亞洲大學共同策畫「地球˙脈動中」生態與藝術特展，並合作發行全台首見的珊瑚生成藝術NFT，喚起社會大眾對生態議題的重視。

更多資訊可參考: https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

metadata.name: September #142
metadata.description:
The Summer Ends
---------------
Controls:
S or double tap (mobile): Download image

A: Toggle loading animation (off by default to improve performance)

1-6: Modify scale (1 = default, 1500 x 2000px, 6 = maximum, 9000 x 12000px (performance intensive, will take a long time to render))
F: Fit to current screen size

T: Toggle grain and texture overlay
H: Toggle shape outlines

B: Cycle border sizes (0 -> 50 -> 75 -> 100 -> 150px)
C: Cycle border colors

I: Cycle visible layers

L: Toggle “live mode”. This mode will continuously redraw a new output every few seconds using the same base parameters as the original output, but with slight variations.

You can modify the x and y url parameters to set a custom size. Note that the image will change to fit the new size, but overall drawing style, colors, etc. will remain the same.
(For example, for a 1000x2000 image, add &x=1000&y=2000)
---------------
teaboswell 2022

10% of primary sales will be donated to Girls Who Code (https://girlswhocode.com)

metadata.name: One Day #23
metadata.description:
One day I will have the peace, the happiness of being able to live quietly, with comfort in peace, nature, and technology side by side. The fresh air and the fast download, the sound of birds and my GPU, a nice sofa, and the calm, cool breeze on my face nourish me to the point of forgetting all my problems. One day... One day all this will be true and only peace will be my gift.

___________________________________________________

|| By pressing S in live mode you can save a image

___________________________________________________

|| Mushrooms have 15%
|| Flowers have 25%

If you are lucky, you can get both
___________________________________________________

Artwork made with p5.js, p5.grain, and much love.

metadata.name: Sub Section Patina #670
metadata.description:
"Sub Section Patina" is inspired by street art and the marks and layering from that art form. If you zoom in on a small section of a wall that artists have marked, sprayed paint, and plastered with posters, some beautiful effects start to happen.

While the "Sub Section Patina" layers are building up, there is a tendency to destroy the layers below. The layering is similar to a wall many street artists have contributed. Sometimes just a section will be covered and filled with something else. Sometimes large areas of the canvas are covered up. Other layers will be put on top of one another, creating a new chaotic image. 

Features:
Four different sizes: 9x16, 11x14", 12x18", 12x12"
Portrait or landscape orientation
~500 color pallets, one black and white, one cyan, magenta, yellow and black, and the rest from Jam3/nice-color-palettes.

Dependencies:
processing/p5.js
lodash/lodash
Jam3/nice-color-palettes
substack/point-in-polygon

Export to a PNG format at several different sizes.
- Press s: save the current render size
- Press t: scale to screen size
- Press f: full print size (see features for dimensions)

License: CC-BY

Please find me on Twitter and Instagram at @natenolting.

metadata.name: Zena #43
metadata.description:
Zena is a study of creating complex patterns via manipulating particle angles using math, bitwise operators and noise.

It can take up to a minute to render or longer in low-performance computers. Enjoy the process!

----Best experienced in full screen----

Probabilities;

- 7 different patterns

- 4 frame types

- 2 frame colors

- 4 different particle hues (Rare; full spectrum) 

- Rare; circular placement

- Rare; dark background

You can right click and save as .png (or press 's' in liveMode) once the rendering is done.



Made with p5.js

Ilgın İçözü, September 2022
@distcollective
